normalized_poster.payload_xml: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8'?> <treasuredBiomesPoster continent="Antarctica"> <title>Antarctica: Peaks, Pack Ice, and the White Horizon</title> <biomes> <biome> <name>Antarctic Peninsula</name> <image url="https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/antarctic-penguins-colony-rest-on-mountain-2498179613" /> <description>The Antarctic Peninsula is a rugged edge of Antarctica with fjords, glaciers, and busy wildlife coasts. In summer, penguins nest near ice and rock while whales and seals feed offshore.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Transantarctic Mountains</name> <image url="https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/icy-rocks-transantarctic-mountains-1421814347" /> <description>The Transantarctic Mountains cut across Antarctica, dividing huge ice sheets. Sharp peaks, dry valleys, and wind‑scoured rock show a stark world where cold and time do most of the work.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Lambert Glacier</name> <image url="https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/aerial-view-sea-snow-covered-beach-2642297637" /> <description>Lambert Glacier is a giant river of ice in East Antarctica. It drains a huge area of the ice sheet and slowly flows toward the coast, feeding the Amery Ice Shelf.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Vinson Massif</name> <image url="https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/antartica-mt-vinson-mountaineering-expedition-2362981231" /> <description>Vinson Massif is Antarctica’s highest mountain. Its steep, icy slopes rise above a vast white wilderness, where extreme cold, wind, and endless snow make every step a serious challenge.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Weddell Sea</name> <image url="https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/icebergs-weddell-sea-antarctica-476199661" /> <description>The Weddell Sea is known for thick pack ice and massive icebergs. Along the shifting ice edge, seals, penguins, and whales find food in cold, nutrient‑rich water.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Antarctic Plateau</name> <image url="https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/sunset-viewed-south-pole-1202349709" /> <description>Antarctica’s plateau is a high, dry desert of ice near the continent’s center. It is flat, brutal, and incredibly cold, with clear skies and long stretches of silence.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>South Georgia Island</name> <image url="https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/thousands-king-penguins-line-rocky-shore-2626420437" /> <description>South Georgia is a sub‑Antarctic island of glaciers and steep mountains. Its beaches swarm with king penguins and seals, making it one of the loudest and richest wildlife coasts on Earth.</description> </biome> </biomes> </treasuredBiomesPoster>
